com.metreeca.rest.handlers.actors

Class Relator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.metreeca.rest.handlers.Delegator
      • com.metreeca.rest.handlers.Actor
        • com.metreeca.rest.handlers.actors.Relator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Handler

    public final class Relator
extends Actor
    LDP resource relator.

    Handles retrieval requests on the linked data resource identified by the request focus item, according to the following operating modes.

    If the focus item is a container and the request includes an expected shape:

    • the response includes the derived shape actually used in the retrieval process, redacted according to request user roles, Form.relate task, Form.convey mode and Form.digest view;
    • the response RDF body includes the RDF description of the container as matched by the container section of redacted shape, linked using the ldp:contains property to the RDF description of the container items matched by the resource section of redacted shape;
    • contained items are selected as required by the LDP container profile identified by rdf:type and LDP properties in the request shape;
    • if the request contains a filtering query, only matching container item descriptions are included.

    Otherwise, if the focus item is a container:

    • the response RDF body includes the symmetric concise bounded description of the container, linked using the ldp:contains property to the symmetric concise bounded description of the container items, extended with rdf:type and rdfs:label/comment annotations for all referenced IRIs;
    • contained items are selected handling the target resource as an LDP Basic Container, that is on the basis of the ldp:contains property.

    Warning / Filtered browsing isn't yet supported on shape-less container.

    In both cases:

    • if the request contains a Prefer header requesting the ldp:preferMinimalContainer representation, item descriptions are omitted.

    Otherwise, if the request includes an expected shape:

    • the response includes the derived shape actually used in the retrieval process, redacted according to request user roles, Form.relate task, Form.detail view and Form.convey mode;
    • the response RDF body contains the RDF description of the request focus, as matched by the redacted request shape.

    Otherwise:

    • the response RDF body contains the symmetric concise bounded description of the request focus item, extended with rdf:type and rdfs:label/comment annotations for all referenced IRIs;

    Regardless of the operating mode, RDF data is retrieved from the system graph database.

    See Also:
    CBD - Concise Bounded Description
